means: 特权，君权，天赋的特权（能力等）

sentence.Network_en: In many countries education is still the prerogative of the rich.
sentence.Network_cn: 在许多国家接受教育仍然是富人的特权。

sentence.Network_en: Making such decisions is not the sole prerogative of managers.
sentence.Network_cn: 作这类决定并不是管理者的专有特权.

sentence.Network_en: It is within his prerogative to do so.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...09年MBA英语阅读理解（精读精解）113 ...prerogative 权力，（尤指）特权chauffeur 受雇开车人，（尤指富人、要人的）司机.
英文知识 - Nothing really matters - 博客大巴 ... royal（ 王室的）， prerogative（ 君权）， authority（ 权力），.

list.abs: prerequisite 必须的prerogative court 遗嘱事件法庭prerogative of mercy 赦免权
prerogative of mercy 赦免权prerogative writ 紧急令prerogative 特权
...国王为了保护白金汉公爵没有选择的解散”议会”，使用皇家特权(Royal prerogative)不经过”议会”进行"强迫贷款"(forced loan)应付因.
...监督政府的恰当表现，但法院以选区拨款申请涉及行政的管理特权（management prerogative）及政策考量驳回他的上诉。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin praerogativa ('the verdict of) the political division which was chosen to vote first in the assembly', feminine (used as noun) of praerogativus 'asked first', from prae 'before' + rogare 'ask'

entry.def: If something is the prerogative of a particular person or group, it is a privilege or a power that only they have.

example.ex: Constitutional changes are exclusively the prerogative of the parliament...
example.tran: 修改宪法是议会独有的权力。

example.ex: It is your prerogative to stop seeing that particular therapist and find another one.
example.tran: 你有权决定不再去看那个治疗师而另找一个。

means.word_mean: 1. a right reserved exclusively by a particular person or group (especially a hereditary or official right);

sentences.sentence: "suffrage was the prerogative of white adult males"

auth_sentence.content: It's not just a national prerogative, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's not just a national prerogative, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's not just a national prerogative, he said.

auth_sentence.content: That's their prerogative: they needn't levy them.
auth_sentence.res_content: That's their prerogative: they needn't levy them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That's their prerogative: they needn't levy them.

auth_sentence.content: Psychopathology was exclusively the prerogative of organic neurologists.
auth_sentence.res_content: Psychopathology was exclusively the prerogative of organic neurologists.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Psychopathology was exclusively the prerogative of organic neurologists.

stems_affixes.word_buile: pre在……前的,预先+built建造的,build的过去式和过去分词→adj.预制的

pre在……前的,预先+cise切→预先切好的→精确的
pre在……前的,预先+coc=coct煮+ious……的→提前煮熟→早熟的
pre在……前的,预先+school学校→上学前的
pre在……前的,预先+sci知道+ent表形容词→预先知道
pre在……前的,预先+amble跑→跑在前面→前言
pre在……前的,预先+caution小心→预先小心→预防
pre在……前的,预先+ced走+ent人或物等→走在前面的东西→先例
pre在……前的,预先+cept拿→以前拿好的[名言]→格言
pre在……前的,预先+cinct捆→预先捆好的→范围
pre在……前的,预先+cipice头→在前面是尽头→峭壁
pre在……前的,预先+cipit头→ation→落在前头→降落,下降
pre在……前的,预先+destination目的地→预先定好的目的地→命中注定
pre在……前的,预先+disposition性情→性情预定→癖性
pre在……前的,预先+fix固定→固定在前面→前缀
pre在……前的,预先+history历史→n.史前
pre在……前的,预先+occup占有+ation表名词→优先占有[注意力]→全神贯注
pre在……前的,预先+position位置→位置放在前面→前置词
pre在……前的,预先+rog要求+ative表名词→预先要求→[有]特权
pre在……前的,预先+ced走+e→走在前面→[时间上]先于
pre在……前的,预先+clud关闭+e→提前关闭→阻止
pre在……前的,预先+dict说→预先说→预言
pre在……前的,预先+fer带来→先带来→更喜欢
pre在……前的,预先+pay付钱→v.预付
ar一再+rog要求,问+ant……的→一再要求的→傲慢的
derogate[v.贬低,诽谤]+ory……的→adj.不敬的,诽谤的
ar一再+rog要求,问+ance表名词→一再要的→arrogance傲慢
pre预先+rog要求+ative……的→预先要求→[有]特权
rog要求,问+ue→无礼要求者
ab去掉+rog要求,问+ate表动词→不再要求有→取消掉
ar一再+rog要求+ate表动词→一再要求→硬是说
de向下,坏+rog要求,问+ate表动词→坏坏的问下去→贬低
inter在……中间+rog要求,问+ate表动词→在[审问室]中问→审问
pro前+rog要求,问+ue→提前问好[下次开会日期]→休会
rog要求,问+ue→无礼要求者
sur下面+rog要求+ate使……→v.使代理, 使代替

sentences.en: one of the prerogatives enjoyed by the president
Making such decisions is not the sole prerogative of managers.
sentences.cn: 作这类决定并不是管理者的专有特权。

sentences.en: The tsar protected his personal prerogatives.
sentences.cn: 沙皇维护了自己的私人特权。
